Package edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.klondike

Class FoundationStrategy

java.lang.Object
edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.klondike.FoundationStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PileStrategy
class FoundationStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements PileStrategy
This PileStrategy encapsulates the rules for a foundation pile in Klondike. Single cards may be dragged onto the pile if either the pile is empty and the card is an ace, or the card's suit matches the top card and its value is one greater.
Author:
bhoward

  • Method Details

    • checkCanDrag

      public boolean checkCanDrag​(Pile foundation)
      Description copied from interface: PileStrategy
      Check whether the given Pile allows packets of one or more cards to be dragged off of it. To avoid lag, this should do minimal computation and return quickly.
      Specified by:
      checkCanDrag in interface PileStrategy
      Returns:
      true if the Pile allows dragging

    • checkCanDrop

      public boolean checkCanDrop​(Pile foundation, java.util.List<Card> packet)
      Description copied from interface: PileStrategy
      Check whether the given Pile will allow a particular Packet to be dropped on it. To avoid lag, this should do minimal computation and return quickly.
      Specified by:
      checkCanDrop in interface PileStrategy
      Returns:
      true if the Pile will allow the Packet to be dropped

    • handleClick

      public void handleClick​(Pile foundation, int numCards)
      Description copied from interface: PileStrategy
      Respond to a click on some number of cards from the top of the given Pile. If only the top card is selected, numCards will be 1. If the Pile is empty, numCards will be 0.
      Specified by:
      handleClick in interface PileStrategy
